title: Arthur Brown (rugby union)
text:
Arthur Brown (born 10 December 1949) is a former <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a> international <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player.
Rugby Union career.
Amateur career.
He played for <a href="Gala%20RFC">Gala</a>.
He was part of the Gala 7s side that won the <a href="Gala%20Sevens">Gala Sevens</a> in 1969 beating Loughborough Colleges in the final; and in 1970, beating <a href="Llanelli%20RFC">Llanelli</a> in the final.
The Gala 7s side of Ken Oliver, Peter Brown, Johnny Brown, Dunc Paterson, Arthur Brown, John Frame and <a href="Drew%20Gill">Drew Gill</a> were a notable side. Nicknamed the "magnificent seven" the Gala 7s won 16 Sevens tournaments between 1970 and 1972.
Provincial career.
He played for <a href="South%20of%20Scotland%20District%20%28rugby%20union%29">South of Scotland District</a>.
International career.
He was capped 5 times for <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a>.
His first two matches for Scotland were against England, in successive weeks. Scotland beat England twice over those 2 weeks; and it remains the only time that this has happened.
